text: Moonfall

A large pillar of dark-green light pulses forth from the Tower of Gorgoth and smashes into the Chaos Moon. Tidal waves of entropic energy pulse through the atmosphere, and Morskrit disgorges its precious gifts. Tretch groans with frustration as the shower of meteors crashes somewhere far to the north, well away from the slopes of Crookback Mountain, as promised. Cursing the Grey Seers for their incompetence, Tretch gathers his raiders and sets out to claim the precious warpstone before someone else gets to it first.
Moonfall

Curses! Vampires from the Silver Pinnacle have reached the impact crater of what has to be one of the largest warpstone meteors Tretch has ever seen. No doubt they seek to harvest the precious substance for some unholy spell. Unacceptable! With a slash of his tail, Tretch orders his Stormvermin forward. The dead will know to fear Clan Rictus, yes-yes!
Lahmian Patrol
Greedy beard-things come for what's mine-mine! Must kill-eat them all!
Shadow Meets Blade

The location of the great power was finally revealed to Snikch through the words of a captured Vampire Admiral, whose ship had floundered on Cathay's treacherous coast.\\n\\n“You are a fool, ratling peon,” the Vampire spat, “for the power you seek is a Daemon of Slaanesh, and no minor Daemon at that! Tz’arkan, the Drinker of Worlds, is a ravenous monster inextricably bound to the soul of a living entity. The only chance of severing the Chaos-imbued bond is to destroy the vessel in which the Daemon is trapped. That vessel is none other than the Druchii known as Malus Darkblade.”\\n\\nThe prospect of wielding the power of a Daemon suddenly sounded very good to the Deathmaster. Almost as soon as he’d ordered his spies to find Darkblade’s location, word returned that the Druchii tyrant was in the area, but about to board his Black Ark back to Naggaroth. He cannot be allowed to escape!
Battle of the Black Pyramid

The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.
Battle for Itza

Lustria’s jungles burn. Its temple-cities crumble. Under Markus Wulfhart’s command, the Emperor’s forces have wreaked havoc in the New World, wantonly plundering the lucrative holdings of the lizard-beasts while sweeping aside all foes sent against them. But now, the most monstrous of them of all has been roused.\\n\\nWulfhart's scouts have informed him that the creature known as the Spirit of the Jungle has been sighted somewhere in the vicinity of Itza. The Huntsmarshal has caught the scent; this will be his toughest hunt yet.
Battle for Itza

One by one, Nakai fought off the so-called great hunters in cahoots with the Huntsmarshal. And one by one, they fled into the jungle like the warm-blooded cowards they are. Nakai correctly sensed they would be back for more, and now the chief warmblood himself, Markus Wulfhart, takes to the field with them. Lustria’s future hangs in the balance, for why else would Nakai be so compelled to act? This conflict ends now!
The Root of Chaos

Though the Great Vortex stifles Daemonkind, a rift in the Witchwood provides Chaos with another passageway into the world. Ariel, demigoddess of the Asrai and avatar of Isha, channels all her power to seal the portal, hoping to prevent the Daemons of the Dreaming Wood from entering the mortal plane. Somehow, scheming Skaven know the Mage Queen is vulnerable, and are preparing to attack. The Sisters of Twilight must dispatch them before they can disrupt Ariel’s efforts and bring cataclysm to the world.
The Ultimate Harvest

Following Throt’s repeated attacks upon the Waystone sites in the Old World, Ariel has begun her ritual in the Witchwood! From the moment Clan Moulder had learned about the Mage Queen’s plans, Throt wondered how such a juicy tip-off could so conveniently land on his lap, but assumed it had something to do with the forest-things’ squabbles amongst themselves. It matters little to him now – with Ariel’s powers focused on her ritual, she is exposed, giving Throt the chance to finally obtain the greatest specimen he will likely ever get his foul claws on. By his haphazard calculations, consuming the demigoddess’ life essence will not only cure his extreme case of the Black Hunger, but could also make him more powerful than he could ever imagine. Moreover, after having his fill, who knows what delightfully horrible things he can create in his laboratory using the leftover Queen-pulp? The possibilities are endless!\\n\\nAs purported by the tree-thing informant, Ariel should be vulnerable while she performs her ritual, but will not be unprotected. She will undoubtedly have her strongest lieutenants defending her, so Throt must fill his ranks with Moulder’s most dangerous monsters to ensure nothing can stop him from claiming Ariel as his prize.
The Blood Queen Strikes

Disaster! A great Druchii fleet has laid siege to the Straits of Lothern, led by the infamous Lokhir Fellheart. While Sea Lord Aislinn and Prince Tyrion saw to the harbour's defence, a smaller contingent made their way into the Inner Sea, masquerading as civilian ships fleeing the conflict. They are led by the Blood Queen of Har Ganeth, Crone Hellebron, and are sailing with all speed for the Isle of the Dead. Whatever her designs for the Great Vortex, they cannot come to pass!
The Crone's Folly

Hellebron's forces have made landfall on the Isle of the Dead, arriving moments before your own troops. The bloodthirsty Crone seeks to offer up Caledor Dragontamer and his archmages in a grand sacrificial ritual to Khaine. Such folly would spell doom not only for Ulthuan, but the whole world. She must be stopped!
Hellebron's Blood Voyage
It seems the Gorequeen and Blood Queen have found common cause. Stand firm, Asur! Protect the Vortex!
The Heart of the Dark

Finally, the beast-paths to the Heart of the Dark are revealed! Taurox had marauded mercilessly through the world, the promise of further gifts of Chaos fuelling his never-ending stampede. His Masters’ true goal, however, had always been to usher the Daemons of Chaos into the world, and only a pilgrimage of sacrifice and Ruin, ending at the Heart of the Dark, would make it so.\\n\\nIt appears others have made the journey also – some with different intentions – but with the final rite within his grasp the Brass Bull will not be denied the Gods’ favour!
The Tears of Isha

The Wood Elves are dwindling. Some perished whilst warring in other lands, fighting for King Orion’s increasingly bloodthirsty Wild Hunts, but most sickened and died as Ariel’s corruption spread through the forests. The Everqueen has gathered many Asrai and Tree Spirits from forest enclaves across the world, and now, with the Treeman Oakheart’s support, she stands ready to confront Ariel directly.
The Tears of Isha

At the heart of Athel Loren, Isha’s chosen and Isha’s avatar stand opposed. Ariel’s tainted soul has drawn fell spirits to her cause, though the Treeman Oakheart and his Asrai allies stand against her. Alarielle must cleanse the corruption that festers within the Queen of the Woods, or all of Athel Loren will surely wither and perish!
A shadow spreads from Ariel's tainted heart, plunging all of Athel Loren into darkness.
Only you can cleanse this curse, Everqueen of Avelorn. Only you can save the forest from itself.
Woodland kin, trust an Elder's wisdom. Fight for your home! Fight for Alarielle!
Ariel's Tainted Wargrove
Oakheart's Wargrove
The blood-crazed King in the Woods leads his Wild Hunt against us!
The Sisters of Twilight come to our aid! Even they can see their mother's peril!
What folly is this? Daemons... freed from the Vaults of Winter? Drive them back to Arranoc!
The Desecration of Avelorn

After making landfall on the shores of Ulthuan, Hellebron wasted no time slaughtering the Elves of Nagarythe and offering their hearts up to her murderous patron's shrine. With the Sword of Khaine now in hand, she leads her Blood Voyage into the verdant forests of Avelorn, leaving a trail of ash and blood in her wake. Such acts of desecration will surely draw the ire of the Everqueen, but Hellebron is unconcerned. Let her come. Her royal blood will make a fine offering to Khaine!
The Desecration of Avelorn

It seems that the preening Everqueen has deigned to forsake the comforts of her pavilion and confront Hellebron's invasion force at the Steps of Isha. Such folly! Have her soft hands ever even held a blade? Garlands and silks have no place on the field of battle, as she will soon discover...
Slaaneshi daemons, drawn by the scent of Elven blood! By Khaine's name, they will taste only death!
There is beauty in violence, ecstasy in carnage. All that stand before me are mere vermin. They shall feel no mercy as I unleash horror and torment upon them!
Khaine! I stand before you seeking the pleasures of war. Blood will flow and I shall bathe this ravaged body anew. Let the slaughter begin!
The Siege of Hell Pit

Throt's ambitions in Norsca have drawn the attention of the Everchosen himself. He has gathered a great host of men and daemons to his banner and now marches on Hell Pit, intent on purging the vermin infestation at its source before it threatens to spread beyond even his control. Furious at the no-fur's impudence, Throt summons his most vicious creations and hurries to reinforce the garrison before battle is joined.
The Siege of Hell Pit

After days of subterranean travel, Throt arrives to Hell Pit only to discover the battle has already begun. Archaon's armies have forced their way inside the warrens, laying waste to the upper levels of Hell Pit in a blaze of blood and ruin. His descent must be stopped at all costs, lest he threaten the defenceless Broodmothers!
Look-see there, the horned-man-thing who gave me Ghoritch, my greatest creation-experiment!
Does he come to take-steal back his gift? No-furs can never be trusted!
Castellan of Hell Pit, do your job! Kill-slay him now-now!
My vengeance is gauranteed. Nothing can stand in my way!
The Everchosen sends his champions! Good-good! More meat-flesh for the war-beasts!
The Legion of Chaos
The Champions of Chaos
Clan Moulder's Monstrous Menagerie
Route
The Slayers from Karak Kadrin come to our aid! Die well, brothers!
Archaon sends his lackeys from the Dark Lands against us. Brace yourselves!
The Supreme Patriarch's overtures to the Cathayans bore fruit, I see. We are honoured to fight by your side, brothers from the east!
The Everchosen takes to the field. Let Ghal Maraz taste that traitor's blood!
King Louen! Tzar Boris! Take heart, men; we do not fight alone!
The Day of Reckoning

Beneath the Blighted Marshes, the source of the Skaven infestation was discovered: a massive labyrinthine undercity; the largest ever seen by any Dwarf in living memory. Could this be the fabled heart of the Skaven empire? Belegar sends word to the High King, who calls for all able-bodied dawi to march on the city. Many grudges will be avenged this day!
The Day of Reckoning

Skavenblight, heart of the wretched Skaven empire, lies exposed for the first time. Belegar and Thorgrim lead their warriors on a death march to the city, drawing the vermins' gaze from the Dawi's true plan. While they fight a hopeless battle against overwhelming odds, sappers from the Engineers Guild work to divert the Tilean Sea. They must hold the line until the filth of the sewers can be washed away, once and for all.\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Since recapturing the hold, Belegar and his kinsmen have withstood plots, alliances, ambushes, super-weapons, and untold deathtraps. Three times they have been rescued by relief forces that broke through the cordon of foes to bring much-needed reinforcements, the last army led by Thorgrim himself. Belegar has sworn a mighty oath to retake Karak Eight Peaks and, inch by bloody inch, Clan Angrund has expanded its foothold. Now, their foes make one final assault with the last reserves of their strength.\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Clan Angrund's conquest of the Eight Peaks is nearly complete. Skarsnik and Queek have joined forces in a desperate, last-ditch attempt to wrest the hold from Belegar's grasp. Break them here and now, and they will never again threaten the Eight Peaks!\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Since recapturing the Eight Peaks from his mutinous subordinates, Skarsnik has repelled repeated assaults from both the Dwarfs and the Skaven. Now, his foes make one final assault with the last reserves of their strength. Break them here and now, and they will never again threaten the Eight Peaks!\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Belegar Ironhammer has emerged from behind his walls, enraged at Skarsnik’s most recent atrocities. All according to plan. From the depths, the Headtaker comes, a great vermintide at his back. The fate of the Eight Peaks hangs in the balance. Will Skarsnik emerge as its One True King, or will he become just another footnote in the pages of its bloody history?\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Since Clan Mors swarmed up from the depths to claim Karak Eight Peaks, Queek has been fighting a constant war of attrition against the last holdouts of the Dwarfs and the Greenskins. Now, the time has come to be rid of them once and for all.\\n
Eight Peaks Eternal

Queek's brazen assault into Skarsnik's lair met with failure. Instead, the Night Goblin Warlord now has his clawpack completely encircled. To make matters worse, the Exile King, Belegar Ironhammer, has chosen this moment to launch his own assault. Disaster looms, but so too does opportunity… an opportunity for Queek to be rid of his two greatest foes once and for all!\\n
The Storm of Chaos

From the Chaos Wastes, Archaon, Lord of the End Times, marches south into the lands of Kislev, a vast horde of daemons, beastmen and northmen following in his wake. The Ice Queen calls for aid, and Karl Franz answers. After assembling a grand alliance of dwarfs, elves and men, he marches north with all haste to meet the Everchosen's forces head-on.\\n
The Storm of Chaos

“It is here, on the outskirts of the cursed city of Praag, where the world's fate will be decided. For too long have the servants of the Ruinous Powers brought misery and death to our lands. The line must be drawn here! By Sigmar, we will take not one step backwards! By Sigmar, the Everchosen falls this day! Let us be rid of their foul taint - now and forever!”
Loyal Dwarfs, the clans of the Karaz Ankor unite!
To the Slayers, I say, chant your battle-hymns of doom, fulfil your oaths and seek glory in death!
To the rest of the throng: destroy these vile creatures. Bring them down like rotten elgi trees.
This is my edict as High King! Khazukan Kazakit-ha!
Yes, my kin, today is a great day! Today we kill urks! Today is vengeance!
For Karak Eight Peaks!
Patience, Gobbla, soon you'll eat, and itz yer favourite - stunty-meat!
Well 'ere dey come now, and dey are all tool'd up ready to fight.
Get ready boyz! I 'ope yer 'ungry, Gobbla!
Dwarf-things! Look how they scurry to us on such little legs!
I'll take head-spine for my trophy rack. More heads, more glory for Queek!
Let us begin...
Da Headtaker finks he can get da jump on us? Gobbla, 'e's yours!
Skarsnik comes to take-steal what is mine-mine! I'll have his head!
The Grand Alliance
The Knights of Snow and Steel
The Lords of Gold and Iron
The Daemonic Legion
The Monstrous Horde
Dark Lands Destroyers
Warhost of the Apocalypse
The Grudgemongers
Once more we will ally with the Manlings, just as Grimnir did ten-score centuries ago!
We will repulse these vile creatures with our dying breath and renew the oldest and greatest alliance this world has ever seen!
Only a fool underestimates his adversary. I will see to it that- We mark another grudge!
It would be unwise to waste- Ready axes!
I will brook no meagerness. Our common cause shall benefit the world.
Agreed. Refusing union weakens us all.
As Sigmar fought, so shall we. We have marched many miles, but there is no distance so great that I would not gladly march it to face this - our ultimate foe!
For Sigmar, for the Empire, for the WARHAMMER!
Southlands Sacrifice

With his mission in the Chaos Wastes complete, Malus begins the journey back to Naggarond. While at sea, he is visited by the Witch King himself, who alights upon Malus' Black Ark atop his draconic mount, Seraphon. He orders Malus to divert to the Skaven-infested jungles of the Southlands and seek out the Temple of Skulls. It is here where the daemons' souls must be sacrificed in order to open an ancient chamber containing the long lost Scrolls of Herkarti.
Rise of Darkness

After obtaining the Scrolls of Herkarti from the Temple of Skulls, Malus prepares to return to Naggaroth aboard his Black Ark. Having already repelled multiple assaults from the ratmen that infest these jungles, he is hardly surprised when yet another horde approaches. It is the Daemon they want, but they must know as well as Malus does that they are going to have to kill him to get it. Malus had heard of the ratman assassin Deathmaster Snikch, but now has the feeling that he may be about to get much more closely acquainted with him...
